analyzed: śivaṃkara tayā proktaḥ śivaḥ pāśupate sthitaiḥ

analyzed: adūra viprakarṣa sthaiḥ vastutaḥ na avagāhibhiḥ

analyzed: aneka janma saṃsidha puṇya pāpa parikṣaye

analyzed: nikṛtte vāsanā jāle samyak vijñāna śastrataḥ

analyzed: saṃvatsara sahasrāṇi pakṣirāj iva saṃpatan
translated: Even if one were to have the speed of mind, flying like the king of birds for thousands of years,

analyzed: tatra sarvāṇi tattvāni niṣīdanti parātmani

analyzed: bhāva abhāvau ubhau protau jñāna sūtra maya ātmanā

analyzed: na vṛttam na api apāvṛttam na āśritam tat anāśritam

analyzed: na duḥkham na sukham na eva nirduḥkham sukham avraṇam
translated: It is not suffering, nor happiness, nor even free from suffering and happiness, nor without a wound.

analyzed: sarva dvandva vinirmuktam sarva upādhi vivarjitam

analyzed: sarva puṇya karī bhāvāt mahīyasī api sā mahī

analyzed: prāṇayantī sva saṃvittyā jagatprāṇā iti īryate

analyzed: parāhata asurūpa tvāt mantramātā prakīrtitā

analyzed: trāyantī gāyataḥ sarvān gāyattrī iti abhidhīyate

analyzed: prakurvatī jagat svena prakṛtiḥ parigīyate

analyzed: aviparyāsa rūpa tvāt satyā satya dvaya anvayāt

analyzed: śānta aśeṣa vikāra tvāt śāntā sā cintyate budhaiḥ

analyzed: mohān apanayantī sā mohinī mohanāt api

analyzed: iḍā haviḥ adhiṣṭhānāt iṣyamāṇa tayā api ca
translated: It is called Iḍā (the left channel) because it is the abode of oblations, and it is called Iṣyāmāṇā (to be desired) because it is to be desired.

analyzed: ramayantī iti sā rantī ratiḥ ca parikīrtitā

analyzed: viśrutiḥ viśrutā sadbhiḥ smārayantī sarasvatī

analyzed: anvarthaiḥ darśita aśeṣa vibhavā vaiṣṇavī parā
translated: having meanings corresponding to them.

analyzed: udadheḥ iva ca sthairyam mahat tā iva vihāyasaḥ
translated: Like the stability of the ocean, the vastness of the great sky,

analyzed: prabhā iva divaseśasya jyotsnā iva himadīdhiteḥ
translated: the radiance of the sun, and the moonlight of the moon,

analyzed: viṣṇoḥ sarva aṅga saṃpūrṇā bhāva abhāva anugāminī
translated: the power of Viṣṇu, complete in all limbs, following existence and non-existence,

analyzed: śaktiḥ nārāyaṇī divyā sarva siddhānta saṃmatā
translated: the divine power of Nārāyaṇa is accepted in all the final conclusions.

analyzed: śaktimataḥ śaktiḥ bhinnā

analyzed: eṣa ca eṣā ca śāstreṣu dharma dharmi svabhāvataḥ

translated: The wife of Viṣṇu, this one, is wonderful in her independent form.

The part of thousands, ten thousands, millions, and countless millions,

analyzed: lakṣmī mayaḥ samunmeṣaḥ sa dvidhā vyavatiṣṭhate
translated: That effulgence which is full of Lakṣmī is twofold,

analyzed: kriyā bhūti vibhedena bhūtiḥ sā ca tridhā matā
translated: It is divided into kriyā (action) and bhūti (prosperity), and that bhūti is considered threefold.

analyzed: unmeṣaḥ yaḥ su saṃkalpaḥ sarvatra avyāhataḥ kṛtau  avyakta kāla puṃs rūpām cetana acetana ātmikām
translated: The effulgence that is good resolution, unobstructed in all actions,

analyzed: bhūtim lakṣmī mayīm viṣṇoḥ śaktim saṃbhāvayati asau
translated: It contemplates the prosperity full of Lakṣmī, the power of Viṣṇu, which is of the nature of the unmanifest, time, and the Puruṣa, consisting of the conscious and the unconscious.
